p2: You may be in a rush to get to that lunch meeting in KL, and you may feel that swerving in and out of traffic or making sudden turns without turning on your signal light is entirely acceptable.
p3: The law reminds us, however, that this certainly isn't the case. In fact, Section 43 of the Road Transport Act 1987 specifically lists careless and inconsiderate driving as an offence against the law.
p4: A person who drives a motor vehicle on a road without due care and attention or without reasonable consideration for another person using the road shall be guilty of an offence....
p5: "Careless and inconsiderate" can be a pretty wide term, but some examples of people charged under this section of the law include taking corners at speed, bad overtaking resulting in an accident, and ramming through other cars.

p2: A fine between RM4,000 and RM10,000, imprisonment for up to 12 months, or both.
p3: Not just that, repeat offenders are at risk of having their driving license suspended while 'P' license drivers may get their license revoked on the first offence.
